thread.title: Search Using the Right Terms and Google May Try and Recruit You
thread.title_full: Search Using the Right Terms and Google May Try and Recruit You

title: Search Using the Right Terms and Google May Try and Recruit You
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
4 Sep 2015 01:41 AM EST 
We all know and have accepted that when you perform a Google search Google is watching. However, what you may not know is Google also watches what you search for on the off chance they want to offer you a job. In fact, they’ll go so far as to interrupt your search to kick off a recruitment test. That is exactly what happened to Max Rosett, former data scientist and now software engineer at Google. Google is always looking for talented software engineers, but the breadth of focus within software development is huge. So, it makes sense for Google to whittle down potential candidates by tagging specific search terms based on the positions they have available. For Rosett, he got detected by Google when he entered the search term “python lambda function list comprehension.”
